text.section:
A person who rents a motor vehicle to a consumer shall:
Compute the daily rental rate based on a 24-hour period, starting at the time the rental begins;
Make a notation on the rental agreement of the time the rental begins; and
Inform the consumer that:
The daily rental fee is based on a 24-hour period; and
The time the rental begins is noted on the rental agreement.

This section does not apply if:
A person rents a motor vehicle to a consumer; and
The rental vehicle is:
A temporary substitute for a vehicle that is out of service because of breakdown, repair, servicing, loss, or destruction; and
Covered as a temporary substitute vehicle under the consumer's comprehensive and collision coverage.

section.section: Regardless of whether a consumer complies with a requirement by a rental company to notify the rental company in advance of intent to return the vehicle, the rental company may not charge for the use of a rental vehicle after the vehicle has been returned.

text.section: In addition to any remedies otherwise available at law, a violation of this section shall be an unfair or deceptive trade practice under Title 13, Subtitle 3 of the Commercial Law Article.
